metadata.Title: CVE-2019-20149 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
ctorName in index.js in kind-of v6.0.2 allows external user input to overwrite certain internal attributes via a conflicting name, as demonstrated by 'constructor': {'name':'Symbol'}. Hence, a crafted payload can overwrite this builtin attribute to manipulate the type detection result.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-20149` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

node-kind-of - 6.0.3+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: node-kind-of package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.0.3+dfsg-1').
